description.narrative: Three consecutive years of drought in the Horn of Africa have caused widespread thirst, hunger and livestock deaths. It has severely affected livelihoods, increased the spread disease and triggered large-scale population movements. Some of the worst-affected communities live along the Mandera triangle, where the borders of Kenya, Somalia and Ethiopia meet. The food insecure population in Kenya has more than doubled in less than a year and an estimated 350,000 children, pregnant women and new mothers are acutely malnourished. Kenya declared a state of emergency due to drought in February 2017. Conditions have deteriorated following poor rainfall in April. Kenya hosts over 600,000 refugees and drought-affected areas in the north-east are receiving further Somali refugees driven by drought and conflict. This investment provides $2.48 million through UNICEF for nutritional assistance to women and children and water, sanitation and hygiene.
